columns.text: In this exercise, we will calculate the present value of the lottery winning if the amount is $1,500,000 in the first year and will receive payment every year for 30 years, increasing by 2.7% per year, and the appropriate discount rate is 6.8%.

We will consider the following details in solving the problem:

| Particulars |            |
|-------------|------------|
| Cash amount | $1,500,000 |
| Rate        | 6.8%       |
| Growth rate | 2.7%       |
| Period      | 30 (years) |

We will use the growing annuity present value formula to determine the value of a future payment with an annual payment increased by a fixed percentage.

The present value of a growing annuity calculates the current value of the future payment based on the compounding period and the steady growth of the rate. Hence we will use the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Growing Annuity Present Value} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\left(\dfrac{1+g}{1+r}\right)^t}{r-g}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount\
$g$ which, means the growth rate\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

To conclude, the present value of the lottery winning of $25,280,038.83 is calculated using the growing annuity present value formula, which considers the period, the discount rate, and the steady growth rate of payment each year.
